Material used.Material Name: WT a-synuclein, A30P a-synuclein, A53T a-synuclein
Material used.Description: α-Synuclein proteins (WT, A30P, and A53T) were kindly provided by Dr. Peter T. Lansbury

Readout description.Result Description: Cu(II) binding to A30P exhibited two binding constants. The major binding site of A30P, characteristic of >90% of the bound Cu(II), has binding constants of 1.6 × 10º and 3.6 × 10º M¯¹ at pH 7.2 and 7.4, respectively. The second less populated binding exhibited by A30P has a large binding constant, ~1010 M¯¹.
Cu(II) binding to A53T at 37 °C is similar to WT with a pH-dependent binding constant (K) of ~2.4 × 10º and ~4.8 × 10º M¯¹ at pH 7.2 and 7.4, respectively.

Cu(II) binds to WT a-synuclein proteins with a 1:1 stoichiometry. The Cu(II) binding constants to WT at 37 °C is similar with a pH-dependent binding constant (K) of ~2.4 × 10º and ~4.8 × 10º M¯¹ at pH 7.2 and 7.4, respectively.

Biological replicates.Description: Two runs for each condition were performed, and the deviations of the fitted results were within 10%.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: A nonlinear least-squares fit of this final expression to the ITC data yields n1, n2, H1, H2, K1, and K2 for the binding of metal (M) to the two types of sites in the macromolecule (P).

Readout description.Result Description: The m/z values of the peaks observed in the MS of A53T in the absence of copper exposure are within 0.2 m/z of the calculated values. The m/z. values of the peaks observed for the sample of A53T exposed to Cu(II)-Gly complex correspond to those expected for the 1:1 Cu(II):A53T complex; no peaks are observed in the MS data that would correspond to the ternary Gly-Cu(II)-A53T complex, and so, we conclude that this species is not present in solution and complexation of Cu(II) by a-synuclein involves displacement of both glycine ligands.

Material used.Material Name: WT a-synuclein, A30P a-synuclein, A53T a-synuclein

Readout description.Result Description: The ThT fluorescence intensities in the presence of WT, A53T, and A30P a-synuclein solutions both before and after ITC titration were of the same level as ThT solution alone, indicating that no fibrils were formed due to Cu(II) binding under the experimental conditions used.

The ThT fluorescence intensities in the presence of WT, A53T, and A30P a-synuclein solutions both before and after ITC titration were of the same level as ThT solution alone, indicating that no fibrils were formed due to Cu(II) binding under the experimental conditions used.

The ThT fluorescence intensities in the presence of WT, A53T, and A30P a-synuclein solutions both before and after ITC titration were of the same level as ThT solution alone, indicating that no fibrils were formed due to Cu(II) binding under the experimental conditions used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: The ThT fluorescence intensities should be similar to ThT solution alone.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: A significant increase in ThT fluorescence indicates fibril formation.

Material used.Material Name: WT a-synuclein, A30P a-synuclein, A53T a-synuclein

Readout description.Result Description: SEC showed that a considerable amount of small aggregates was formed for solutions of WT and A53T but not for A30P. The Cu(II) binding isotherms of these samples are the same as those found for freshly made samples.

SEC showed that a considerable amount of small aggregates was formed for solutions of WT and A53T but not for A30P. The Cu(II) binding isotherms of these samples are the same as those found for freshly made samples.

SEC showed that a considerable amount of small aggregates was formed for solutions of WT and A53T but not for A30P. The Cu(II) binding isotherms of these samples are the same as those found for freshly made samples.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of higher molecular weight peaks indicating aggregation.
